Coupon Alert: Help
Quick Start
General Information
Screenshots
Press “New Coupon” to enter a coupon.
Press “View or Edit” to view and edit coupons.
In “View or Edit”, press a coupon to edit it, long-press a coupon to delete it.
Use the Options Menu (Android 3.x and later) or Android menu button (Android 2.x and earlier) to navigate to other screens.
There will be two alerts for each coupon: one at 5 am on the date of expiration and one at 5 am two days before.
Detailed Directions
What this app does

This app is for those of us who forget about their coupons until after the expiration date. The app is simple. You add in the coupon details manually, and the app will alert you twice about the coupon: once 2 days before it expires, and once on the day of expiration. You can edit the coupons after they’ve been saved, and you can delete them.

While the app was intended specifically for coupon reminders, it can be used to remind yourself about anything.
Caution
If an alert comes while the device is off, it’ll only display once you turn the device back on. The app does not turn on the device.\n
App navigation

On the front screen, select \"New Coupon\", \"View or Edit\" or \"Help\". In the Help screens, press back to return to the previous screen. Otherwise use the Options Menu to navigate from screen to screen. If using Android 2.x or earlier, the Menu button (typically at bottom) is pressed to access the Options Menu.\n
Alerts
Alerts arrive at 5 am on the coupon’s expiration date and 5 am two days before the expiration date.\n
In the future

If there’s enough interest, I’m thinking of creating a paid (but still cheap, probably $0.99) version which allows you to choose how many alerts you want for a coupon, when they come, and the ability to categorize and filter coupons. Suggestions are welcomed.\n
Screenshots/Detailed Directions
Front Page
Deleting/marking coupon as used
Edit Coupon
Alerts
The following screenshots were taken on a Samsung Galaxy S5 running Android 4.4.4 (KitKat).
Press “New Coupon” to input a new coupon.
Press “View or Edit” to view or edit existing coupons.
Press “Help” to access this screen.
On the “New Coupon” screen, enter your coupon\'s information.
If the “Amount” value has up to two decimal places, the app will automatically change it to show a dollar amount (5 will show up as $5.00, .5 as $0.50). Words can also be entered.
Date values must be separated by dashes (e.g., "5–31–15" is correct but "5/31/15" is not).
Scroll down to the “Save Coupon” button to save the coupon and create alerts.
Press “View Coupons” to view all saved coupons. If "View Coupons" is entered before "Save Coupon" is pressed, any changes will be lost.
“VIEW OR EDIT” at top can be pressed to access the same screen as the “View Coupons” button.
Users of Android 2.x will need to press the phone’s Menu button to see the “View or Edit” or “Help” options seen here.
The “View or Edit” screen allows you to see saved coupons and edit them.
On the top line of the coupon, the store and amount appear in bold, and the date entered appears in blue. Below that is the product text. If notes are entered, they appear indented at bottom.
Press the coupon to edit the coupon. The “Edit Coupon” screen will open up (it looks very similar to the “New Coupon” screen described before).
Long-press the button to delete the coupon or mark it as used.
Click the “NEW COUPON” button at top to enter a new coupon.
Users of Android 2.x will need to press the phone’s Menu button to see the “View or Edit” or “Help” options seen here.
After a coupon is long pressed, a dialog pops up.
Press “Yes” to completely delete the coupon and any remaining alerts.

Press “Mark as Used” to cancel any remaining alerts without deleting the coupon. The coupon will show up as grayed out on the “View or Edit” screen and the text “USED” will appear. If “Mark as Used” is pressed mistakenly, edit the coupon and delete the text “USED”.
Press “Cancel” to return to the “View or Edit” screen.
After a coupon is long pressed, a dialog pops up.
Press “Yes” to completely delete the coupon and any remaining alerts.

Press “Mark as Used” to cancel any remaining alerts without deleting the coupon. The coupon will show up as grayed out on the “View or Edit” screen and the text “USED” will appear. If “Mark as Used” is pressed mistakenly, edit the coupon and delete the text “USED”.
Press “Cancel” to return to the “View or Edit” screen.
After pressing the coupon, the Edit Coupon screen appears, where you can edit any of the information.
Scroll down and press “Save Edits” to save any changes.
Press “View Coupons” to return to the “View or Edit” screen.
Alerts will arrive two days before the date entered for a coupon and on the day entered. Alerts arrive at 5 am.
Alerts will arrive even if the screen is off.
If alerts arrive when the phone is powered down (i.e., completely turned off), the alerts will display soon after the phone is turned on the next time.
Alerts will be shown in the Notifications pull-down screen, one entry for each alert. On most phones, to display the Notifications screen, swipe down from the top of the phone’s screen.
If multiple alerts are present on the Notifications screen, tap the most recent one to open the View or Edit screen of the app.

When an alert has arrived, the “cent” icon, which can be seen on the right on the Notifications screen, will also appear in the Notification Bar, which is the thin box at the top of the screen (i.e., the one that shows remaining battery percentage, the time, etc.).
The store, product and amount values of the coupon will appear in the alert text.

In the above screenshot, the two entries with a "cent" icon are alerts from this app. The other entry (i.e., "Connected as a media device") is unrelated to this app. The date the alerts were received is 10/14. One ABC Mart coupon is scheduled to expire that day, and another ABC Mart coupon is scheduled to expire two days later.
Image of the New Coupon screen with sample values filled in.
Image of the View or Edit screen displaying a single sample coupon.
Image of the message box asking the user whether they want to delete the coupon.
Image of the Notification pull-down screen with two sample notification entries.
